hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via Taker Flow Gamma Squeeze
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) and experiences a sustained positive taker flow (>2 standard deviations above 20-day mean) for 3 consecutive days, followed by a 5% price breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound, the regime will transition to BULL within 5 trading days with 70% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Taker flow represents institutional/aggressive buying. Sustained positive flow in neutral regimes indicates accumulation before breakout. Gamma exposure from options positioning can accelerate moves once technical levels break.
entry_conditions: BTC taker flow > +2σ above 20-day rolling mean for 3 consecutive days
BTC price breaks above 20-day Bollinger Band upper bound by >5%

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price retraces below breakout level (20-day BB upper bound)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain, price returns to range, taker flow reverses negative within 2 days of breakout
